quotes.quote: Liberty is obedience to the law which one has laid down for oneself.
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.quote: Better than worshiping gods is obedience to the laws of righteousness.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.quote: Obedience brings success; exact obedience brings miracles.
quotes.author: Russell M. Nelson

quotes.quote: Obedience is the primary object of all sound education.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Missing Sewell

quotes.quote: Obedience to lawful authority is the foundation of manly character.
quotes.author: Robert E. Lee

quotes.quote: True obedience is true freedom.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: Obedience isn't a lack of fear. It's just doing it scared.
quotes.author: Jen Hatmaker

quotes.quote: Obedience indeed is only the pitiful and cowardly egotism of him who thinks that he can do something better than reason.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.quote: When obedience is so impious, revolt is a necessity.
quotes.author: Pierre Corneille

quotes.quote: A great work is made out of a combination of obedience and liberty.
quotes.author: Nadia Boulanger

quotes.quote: The great test of life is obedience to God.
quotes.author: Ezra Taft Benson

quotes.quote: Obedience completes itself in understanding.
quotes.author: Phillips Brooks

quotes.quote: Disobedience, in the eyes of any one who has read history, is man's original virtue. It is through disobedience that progress has been made, through disobedience and through rebellion.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: One act of obedience is better than one hundred sermons.
quotes.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quotes.quote: Obedience of the law is demanded; not asked as a favor.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Obedience is the opener of eyes.
quotes.author: George Macdonald

quotes.quote: Obedience is less painful than regret.
quotes.author: Christine Caine

quotes.quote: Obedience simulates subordination as fear of the police simulates honesty.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Obedience and resignation are our personal offerings upon the altar of duty.
quotes.author: Hosea Ballou

quotes.quote: Obedience is a part of greatness.
quotes.author: Mark E. Petersen

quotes.quote: For there is no obedience without humility, nor humility without charity.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.quote: Obedience alone gives the right to command.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Obedience is your responsibility, the outcome is God's!
quotes.author: Steven Furtick

quotes.quote: Obedience is the mother of success and is wedded to safety.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.quote: Obedience to God is the pathway to the life you really want to live.
quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

quotes.quote: The virtue of obedience makes the will supple. It inspires the courage with which to fulfill the most difficult tasks.
quotes.author: John Vianney

quotes.quote: Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Obedience is the crown and honour of all virtue.
quotes.author: Martin Luther

quotes.quote: Obedience is an act of faith; disobedience is the result of unbelief.
quotes.author: Edwin Louis Cole

quotes.quote: Obedience shows whether you are grateful.
quotes.author: Catherine Of Siena

quotes.quote: By eating many fruits and vegetables in place of fast food and junk food, people could avoid obesity.
quotes.author: David H. Murdock

quotes.quote: The rise of childhood obesity has placed the health of an entire generation at risk.
quotes.author: Tom Vilsack

quotes.quote: Obesity is a problem that nearly every nation in the world is facing, but there is much that we can do to fix it.
quotes.author: Richard Attias

quotes.quote: Childhood obesity is best tackled at home through improved parental involvement, increased physical exercise, better diet and restraint from eating.
quotes.author: Bob Filner

quotes.quote: If we don't somehow stem the tide of childhood obesity, we're going to have a huge problem.
quotes.author: Lance Armstrong

quotes.quote: Obesity affects every aspect of a people's lives, from health to relationships.
quotes.author: Jane Velezmitchell

quotes.quote: If the childhood obesity epidemic remains unchecked, it will condemn many of our kids to shorter lives, as well as the emotional and financial burdens of poor health.
quotes.author: Richard Carmona

quotes.quote: Obesity is a drain on the economy - we have to pay for the health care of fat people who are usually poor and can't afford insurance. Obesity is, well, bad.
quotes.author: Emily Levine

quotes.quote: Obesity among young Americans is a serious problem that can have serious ramifications in the long run.
quotes.author: Virginia Foxx

quotes.quote: Fixing obesity is going to require a change in our modern relationship with food. I'm hopeful that we begin to see a turnaround in this childhood obesity epidemic.
quotes.author: S. Jay Olshansky

quotes.quote: How much obesity has to be created in a single decade for people to realize that diet has to be responsible for it?
quotes.author: Robert Atkins

quotes.quote: Obesity is racing through America, everywhere. It's high time someone spent some money to do something about it.
quotes.author: David H. Murdock

quotes.quote: Obesity isn't as cool as it used to be, back in the earlier centuries. Before it was a reflection on your gross income, and now it's just gross.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz

quotes.quote: ...obesity isn't caused by those who adore food. People tend not to put on weight through eating meals. I'd say it's people who eat non-stop.
quotes.author: Nigella Lawson

quotes.quote: Obesity is a mental state, a disease brought on by boredom and disappointment.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: Epidemic obesity is arguably the gravest public health crisis we face and inarguably the least controlled.
quotes.author: David L. Katz

quotes.quote: Obesity is a condition which proves that the Lord does not help those who help themselves and help themselves and help themselves.
quotes.author: Adelle Davis

quotes.quote: There are worse things than being fat, and one of them is worrying about it all the time.
quotes.author: Peg Bracken

quotes.quote: Childhood obesity isn't some simple, discrete issue. There's no one cause we can pinpoint. There's no one program we can fund to make it go away. Rather, it's an issue that touches on every aspect of how we live and how we work.
quotes.author: Michelle Obama

quotes.quote: Ultimately, what may be needed to address the obesity problem are direct taxes on body weight.
quotes.author: Jonathan Gruber

quotes.quote: With the chronic obesity in America, it's more important than ever to not only feed kids healthy foods but to teach them how to make healthy choices on their own.
quotes.author: Jennie Garth

quotes.quote: Epidemic obesity is unquestionably a health crisis in the United States, and for that matter, in much of the world. But it is a crisis in slow motion, one that has crept up on us over years, and even decades.
quotes.author: David Katz

quotes.quote: People tend to think of overweight and obesity as strictly a personal matter, but there is much that communities can and should do to address these problems.
quotes.author: David Satcher

quotes.quote: Tackling childhood obesity is key.
quotes.author: Diane Abbott

quotes.quote: To say that obesity is caused by merely consuming too many calories is like saying that the only cause of the American Revolution was the Boston Tea Party.
quotes.author: Adelle Davis

quotes.quote: I know the problem of obesity. I got to tell you, I think that's tepid. I just don't think the bully pulpit is going to be enough to sufficiently fight obesity. We're going to have to have incentives in here.
quotes.author: Max Baucus

quotes.quote: Overweight and obesity is the second leading cause of death, killing 300,000 people a year, There is not a miracle pill that will lead to weight loss.
quotes.author: Richard Carmona

quotes.quote: To call yourself 'plus size' is just a euphemism for being fat. Life is much easier when you're thinner. Big is not beautiful, of course a job comes down to how you look.
quotes.author: Kate Hopkins

quotes.quote: Being overweight and obesity are major risk factors for many chronic diseases for South Dakotans of all ages. When people are overweight or obese, they have more health problems and more serious health problems, in addition to higher health care costs.
quotes.author: Mike Rounds

quotes.quote: Obesity is the result of a loss of self-control. Indeed, loss of self-control might be said to be the defining social (or anti-social) characteristic of our age: public drunkenness, excessive gambling, promiscuity and common-or-garden rudeness are all examples of our collective loss of self-control.
quotes.author: Theodore Dalrymple

quotes.quote: It is so hard to believe because it is so hard to obey.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.quote: If you obey all the rules you miss all the fun.
quotes.author: Katharine Hepburn

quotes.quote: Obeying from love is better than to obey from fear.
quotes.author: Rashi

quotes.quote: Obey your head. Obey your heart. Obey your gut. In fact, obey everything except commands.
quotes.author: Matt Haig

quotes.quote: Obedience leads to true freedom. The more we obey revealed truth, the more we become liberated.
quotes.author: James E. Faust

quotes.quote: Obey the principles without being bound by them.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.quote: Be obedient even when you do not know where obedience may lead you.
quotes.author: Sinclair B. Ferguson

quotes.quote: You cannot be a true man until you learn to obey.
quotes.author: Robert E. Lee

quotes.quote: There is one thing in the world more wicked than the desire to command, and that is the will to obey.
quotes.author: William Kingdon Clifford

quotes.quote: Only he who believes is obedient, and only he who is obedient believes.
quotes.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quotes.quote: It is difficult to press forward if we do not know how to obey.
quotes.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.quote: If we are really going to learn from others, we must decide to fully obey.
quotes.author: Ed Townsend

quotes.quote: Be obedient to your superior, and your inferior will obey you.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: Society is well governed when the people obey the magistrates, and the magistrates obey the law.
quotes.author: Solon

quotes.quote: It is not hard to obey when we love the one whom we obey.
quotes.author: Saint Ignatius

quotes.quote: You cannot obey God without your obedience spilling out in a blessing to all those around you.
quotes.author: Adrian Rogers

quotes.quote: We are born free, but we're taught to obey orders.
quotes.author: Marty Rubin

quotes.quote: As people who obey God, we're also supposed to obey the laws of man, and we intend to do that.
quotes.author: Steve Drain

quotes.quote: The ship that will not obey the helm will have to obey the rocks.
quotes.author: English Proverb

quotes.quote: If you obey the technique to perfection, that technique will become invisible.
quotes.author: Alan Chadwick

quotes.quote: The art of living consists in knowing which impulses to obey and which must be made to obey.
quotes.author: Sydney J. Harris

quotes.quote: Obedience is not measured by our ability to obey laws and principles, obedience is measured by our response to God's voice.
quotes.author: Bill Johnson

quotes.quote: The only safe ruler is he who has learned to obey willingly.
quotes.author: Thomas a Kempis

quotes.quote: Obey your soul, have perfect faith in yourself. Never think of yourself with doubt or distrust, or as one who makes mistakes.
quotes.author: Wallace D. Wattles

quotes.quote: Those who know the least obey the best.
quotes.author: George Farquhar

quotes.quote: Life is about obeying laws, it begins with observing the divine laws.
quotes.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.quote: You must obey the law, always, not only when they grab you by your special place.
quotes.author: Vladimir Putin

quotes.quote: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.quote: People obey to people with ideas... so visualize it like this... when you don't have ideas and meaning in life you obey to somebody who already got answers of this two things.
quotes.author: Deyth Banger

quotes.quote: In life when God calls you, all you have to do is answer.
quotes.author: Angel Moreira

quotes.quote: Until today, you may not have realized that your life provides the content of your obituary. Just for today, examine your life. Think about all of the things you want to leave behind. Remember, the good thing about doing this today is that you still have time to rewrite your life's content if necessary.
quotes.author: Iyanla Vanzant

quotes.quote: Read obituaries. They are just like biographies, only shorter. They remind us that interesting, successful people rarely lead orderly, linear lives.
quotes.author: Charles Wheelan

quotes.quote: Beyond being timely, an obituary has a more subjective duty: to assess its subject's impact.
quotes.author: Walter Cronkite

quotes.quote: All publicity is good, except an obituary notice.
quotes.author: Brendan Behan

quotes.quote: Read your own obituary notice; they say you live longer. Gives you second wind. New lease of life.
quotes.author: James Joyce

quotes.quote: If you cannot display gloominess when announcing obituary, better eat bitter kola with garlic beforehand and beforeleg.
quotes.author: Vincent Okay Nwachukwu

quotes.quote: May our obituaries someday say—preferably after we're dead, of course—that we lived in peace, in love, and mostly in grace.
quotes.author: Jaime Jo Wright

quotes.quote: No eulogy is due to him who simply does his duty and nothing more.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

quotes.quote: One way to evaluate your own reputation is to think about what would be said of you at your eulogy.
quotes.author: Brian Koslow

quotes.quote: Carve your name on hearts, not tombstones. A legacy is etched into the minds of others and the stories they share about you.
quotes.author: Shannon Alder

quotes.quote: A eulogy is a life lived with a loved one or friend condensed into a few moments relating poignant and witty stories about them to a hushed congregation. The deceased has then an eternity to ponder the remarks with the possibility of spectral visitations to request a retraction.
quotes.author: Stewart Stafford

quotes.quote: It's like obituaries, when you die they finally give you good reviews.
quotes.author: Roger Maris

quotes.quote: If you start the day reading the obituaries, you live your day a little differently.
quotes.author: David Levithan

quotes.quote: Eulogy. Praise of a person who has either the advantages of wealth and power, or the consideration to be dead.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: In a bid to leave behind something worth more than an obituary notice on posters, some dance with death as if their present life is a photocopy only to be disappointed that it is actually the original when faced with a kiss of death.
quotes.author: Vincent Okay Nwachukwu

quotes.quote: There is no such thing as bad publicity except your own obituary.
quotes.author: Brendan Behan

quotes.quote: People have anÂ obligationÂ to live up to their potential.
quotes.author: Bette Midler

quotes.quote: You have noÂ obligationÂ under the sun other than to discover your real needs, to fulfill them, and to rejoice in doing so.
quotes.author: Francois Rabelais

quotes.quote: The nation'sÂ obligationÂ to her defenders is as old as that defense itself.
quotes.author: Steve Buyer

quotes.quote: Nobody is bound by any obligation unless it has first been freely accepted.Â
quotes.author: Ugo Betti

quotes.quote: It is as much ourÂ obligationÂ not to cooperate with evil as it is to cooperate with good.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Do not allowÂ obligationÂ or immediacy to bind you to physical things or specific actions.
quotes.author: Mary Anne Radmacher

quotes.quote: It is every man'sÂ obligationÂ to put back into the world at least the equivalent of what he takes out of it.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: We all have a moralÂ obligationÂ to leave this world a better place than the world that we've found.
quotes.author: Tim McIlrath

quotes.quote: Your only obligation in any lifetime is to be true to yourself. Being true to anyone else or anything else is not only impossible, but the mark of a fake messiah.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: Perhaps it is ourÂ obligationÂ to be noble before it is ourÂ obligationÂ to be happy.
quotes.author: Kathleen McGowan

quotes.quote: We have a moralÂ obligationÂ to act happy even if we don't feel it.
quotes.author: Dennis Prager

quotes.quote: We have anÂ obligationÂ to help people that cannot help themselves. The mentally retarded, the physically retarded, et cetera.
quotes.author: Lou Holtz

quotes.quote: All moralÂ obligationÂ resolves itself into theÂ obligationÂ of conformity to the will of God.
quotes.author: Charles Hodge

quotes.quote: We haveÂ obligations towards the innocent, the dead, towards the living, towards our children and their children.
quotes.author: Ricardo Lagos

quotes.quote: EthicalÂ obligationÂ has to subordinate itself to the totalitarian nature of war.
quotes.author: Karl Brandt

quotes.quote: Our majorÂ obligationÂ is not to mistake slogans for solutions.
quotes.author: Edward R. Murrow

quotes.quote: If you are living out of a sense of obligation you are slave.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: It is an eternal obligation toward the human being not to let him suffer from hunger when one has a chance of coming to his assistance.
quotes.author: Simone Weil

quotes.quote: We all have some basic obligation to one another.
quotes.author: Richard N. Haass

quotes.quote: It is our moral obligation to give every child the very best education possible.
quotes.author: Desmond Tutu

quotes.quote: It is the solemn obligation of a leader always to be a leader. Even when - perhaps especially when - you don't feel like being a leader.
quotes.author: Bill Owens

quotes.quote: Nobody has a more sacredÂ obligationÂ to obey the law than those who make the law.
quotes.author: Jean Anouilh

quotes.quote: We have anÂ obligationÂ to fight for the world as it should be.
quotes.author: Michelle Obama

quotes.quote: To place yourself under anÂ obligationÂ is to sell your liberty.
quotes.author: Decimus Laberius

quotes.quote: ObligationÂ is a more effective weapon against the Will than any penalty, threat or act of force.
quotes.author: Ashim Shanker

quotes.quote: AnÂ obligationÂ to feel can freeze feelings.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: One of the firstÂ obligations of art is to make all useful things beautiful.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.quote: AnÂ obligationÂ is something which constrains or induces us to act.
quotes.author: Francis Jeffrey

quotes.quote: TheÂ obligationÂ to endure gives us the right to know.
quotes.author: Rachel Carson

quotes.quote: We have no more fundamentalÂ obligationÂ in government than to ensure the safety of our citizens.
quotes.author: Bob Ehrlich

quotes.quote: Oblivion has been noticed as the offspring of silence.
quotes.author: Hannah More

quotes.quote: A wholesome oblivion of one's neighbours is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.author: Richard Le Gallienne

quotes.quote: Oblivion cures the old wounds.
quotes.author: Dejan Stojanovic

quotes.quote: Death promises nothing-not even oblivion.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: Sing then the core of dark and absolute oblivion where the soul at last is lost in utter peace.
quotes.author: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.quote: Oblivion is the rule and fame the exception, of humanity.
quotes.author: Antoine Rivarol

quotes.quote: Being unconscious is the ultimate disability.
quotes.author: Jessa Gamble

quotes.quote: Oblivion is full of people who allow the opinions of others to overrule their belief in themselves.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Oblivion is the flower that grows best on graves.
quotes.author: George Sand

quotes.quote: Oblivion waits without beckoning or threatening.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: There is no revenge like oblivion, for it is the entombment of the unworthy in the dust of their own nothingness.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.quote: The ninety percent of human experience that does not fit into established narrative patterns falls into oblivion.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: There is no better guide to this world than oblivion.
quotes.author: Sorin Cerin

quotes.quote: A few names have survived oblivion. In time, oblivion will have them all.
quotes.author: Marty Rubin

quotes.quote: Our unconscious is not more animal than our conscious, it is often even more human.
quotes.author: Edward Bond

quotes.quote: Oblivion is the dark page, whereon Memory writes her light-beam characters, and makes them legible; were it all light, nothing could be read there, any more than if it were all darkness.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: We were a silent, hidden thought in the folds of oblivion, and we have become a voice that causes the heavens to tremble.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: The unconscious in us warns us that in art we have to follow one particular path. And if we follow it, it is not the sign of anunconscious act.On the contrary, it shows that there is in our ordinary consciousness a greater awareness of our unconsciousness.
quotes.author: Piet Mondrian

quotes.quote: Apathy is a sort of living oblivion.
quotes.author: Horace Greeley

quotes.quote: All things fade into the storied past, and in a little while are shrouded in oblivion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: There was existence in oblivion; there is you in oblivion.
quotes.author: Pushpa Rana

quotes.quote: Just because you're living in blissful oblivion doesn't mean you're not responsible.
quotes.author: Arthur M. Jolly

quotes.quote: Never let the meaning of your love light escape to the dark nothingness of oblivion.
quotes.author: Sorin Cerin

quotes.quote: Death is the stone into which our oblivion hardens.
quotes.author: Pablo Neruda

quotes.quote: Consolation Calm down. Both your sins and your good deeds will be lost in oblivion.
quotes.author: Czeslaw Milosz

quotes.quote: Ultimately life is disease, death and oblivion. It's still better than high school.
quotes.author: Dan Savage

quotes.quote: Time is the River on which the leaves of our thoughts are carried into oblivion.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing

quotes.quote: Oblivion has always been the most trustworthy guardian of classified files.
quotes.author: Lee Sandlin

quotes.quote: Oblivion seemed the only reasonable option.
quotes.author: Ian McEwan

quotes.quote: Pleasure is a sort of oblivion, a forgetfulness. Pain is remembrance, you cannot forget pain.
quotes.author: Bhagwan Shree

quotes.quote: While fame impedes and constricts, obscurity wraps about a man like a mist; obscurity is dark, ample, and free; obscurity lets the mind take its way unimpeded. Over the obscure man is poured the merciful suffusion of darkness. None knows where he goes or comes. He may seek the truth and speak it; he alone is free; he alone is truthful, he alone is at peace.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.quote: The obscure we see eventually. The completely obvious, it seems, takes longer.
quotes.author: Edward R. Murrow

quotes.quote: If I could I would always work in silence and obscurity, and let my efforts be known by their results.
quotes.author: Emily Brontë

quotes.quote: Notoriety wasn't as good as fame, but was heaps better than obscurity.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.quote: The obscure only exists that it may cease to exist. In it lies the opportunity of all victory and all progress. Whether it call itself fatality, death, night, or matter, it is the pedestal of life, of light, of liberty and the spirit. For it represents resistance -- that is to say, the fulcrum of all activity, the occasion for its development and its triumph.
quotes.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.quote: One of the worse states to be in, is to be ignored. Obscurity like insecurity, kills!
quotes.author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

quotes.quote: Those who know that they are profound strive for clarity. Those who would like to seem profound to the crowd strive for obscurity.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Well has he lived who has lived well in obscurity.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: Obscurity and competence—that is the life that is best worth living.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Obscurity and Innocence, twin sisters, escape temptations which would pierce their gossamer armor, in contact with the world.
quotes.author: Nicolas Chamfort

quotes.quote: The soul languishing in obscurity contracts a kind of rust, or abandons itself to the chimera of presumption; for it is natural for it to acquire something, even when separated from any one.
quotes.author: Quintilian

quotes.quote: I never knew how good it is to be unknown until now. The last time I was unknown I was too busy trying to become known to realize the advantages of obscurity.
quotes.author: Alec Guinness

quotes.quote: We inhabit an obscure planet, in an obscure galaxy, around an obscure sun, but on the other hand, modern human society represents one of the most complex things we know.
quotes.author: David Christian

quotes.quote: Be obscure clearly.
quotes.author: E.B. White

quotes.quote: In one case out of a hundred a point is excessively discussed because it is obscure; in the ninety-nine remaining it is obscure because it is excessively discussed.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: In labouring to be concise, I become obscure.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: The great work must inevitably be obscure, except to the very few, to those who like the author himself are initiated into the mysteries. Communication then is secondary: it is perpetuation which is important. For this only one good reader is necessary.
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.quote: The first step to wisdom is to avoid the common fallacy which considers everything profound that is obscure.
quotes.author: Gregory Nunn

quotes.quote: I'm never going to accomplish anything; that's perfectly clear to me. I'm never going to be famous. My name will never be writ large on the roster of Those Who Do Things. I don't do anything. Not one single thing. I used to bite my nails, but I don't even do that any more.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: I would rather be attacked than unnoticed. For the worst thing you can do to an author is to be silent as to his works.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: The idea of being forgotten is terrifying. I fear not just that I, personally, will be forgotten but that we are all doomed to being forgotten; that the sum of life is ultimately nothing; that we experience joy and disappointment and aches and delights and loss, make our little mark on the world, and then we vanish, and the mark is erased, and it is as if we never existed.
quotes.author: Susan Orlean

quotes.quote: I'm afraid of losing my obscurity. Genuineness only thrives in the dark. Like celery.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Full many a flower is born to blush unseen, And waste its fragrance on the desert air.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: If I am ever obscure in my expressions, do not fancy that therefore I am deep. If I were really deep, all the world would understand, though they might not appreciate. The perfectly popular style is the perfectly scientific one. To me an obscurity is a reason for suspecting a fallacy.
quotes.author: Charles Kingsley

quotes.quote: One must choose between obscurity with efficiency, and fame with its inevitable collateral of bluff.
quotes.author: William McFee

quotes.quote: Obscurity can be a fire of ambition in those who have stalwart souls.
quotes.author: Taylor Caldwell

quotes.quote: I give the fight up: let there be an end, a privacy, an obscure nook for me. I want to be forgotten even by God.
quotes.author: Robert Browning

quotes.quote: It is human nature to instinctively rebel at obscurity or ordinariness.
quotes.author: Taylor Caldwell

quotes.quote: Everybody is so talented nowadays that the only people I care to honor as deserving real distinction are those who remain in obscurity.
quotes.author: Thomas Hardy

quotes.quote: The mind's passion is all for singling out. Obscurity has another tale to tell.
quotes.author: Adrienne Rich

quotes.quote: Observation is an old man's memory.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: Observation capitalizes inspiration.
quotes.author: Alex Faickney Osborn

quotes.quote: Observation, not old age, brings wisdom.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Is there an observation which is not the instrument of thought?
quotes.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quotes.quote: Where observation is concerned, chance favors only the prepared mind.
quotes.author: Louis Pasteur

quotes.quote: Observations not only disturb what is to be measured, they produce it.
quotes.author: Pascual Jordan

quotes.quote: Extraordinary observations require extraordinary evidence to make them believable.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: In the mere observation of yourself, you begin the process of healing and transformation.
quotes.author: Deepak Chopra

quotes.quote: The power of accurate observation is commonly called cynicism by those who have not got it.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: All observations of life are harsh, because life is. I lament that fact, but I cannot change it.
quotes.author: Margaret Atwood

quotes.quote: A few observation and much reasoning lead to error; many observations and a little reasoning to truth.
quotes.author: Alexis Carrel

quotes.quote: True observation begins when devoid of set patterns; freedom of expression occurs when one is beyond system.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.quote: It's on the strength of observation and reflection that one finds a way. So we must dig and delve unceasingly.
quotes.author: Claude Monet

quotes.quote: If there's one observation that rings true in today's changing world, it is that freedom and peace go hand in hand.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: The attitude of silent observation is the very foundation of yoga. You see the picture, but you are not the picture.
quotes.author: Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj

quotes.quote: That observation which is called knowledge of the world will be found much more frequently to make men cunning than good.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: A journey of observation must leave as much as possible to chance. Random movement is the best plan for maximum observation
quotes.author: Tahir Shah

quotes.quote: A careful observation of Nature will disclose pleasantries of superb irony. She has for instance placed toads close to flowers.
quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac

quotes.quote: It is the close observation of little things which is the secret of success in business, in art, in science, and in every pursuit of life.
quotes.author: Samuel Smiles

quotes.quote: Observation always involves theory.
quotes.author: Edwin Powell Hubble

quotes.quote: When you make an observation, you have an obligation.
quotes.author: M. K. Asante

quotes.quote: The observation of nature is part of an artist's life.
quotes.author: Henry Moore

quotes.quote: Self-observation is the first step of inner unfolding.
quotes.author: Amit Ray

quotes.quote: Observation is the most enduring of the pleasures of life.
quotes.author: George Meredith

quotes.quote: Let observation with extended observation observe extensively.
quotes.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quotes.quote: Reason, observation, and experience; the holy trinity of science.
quotes.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quotes.quote: Accuracy of observation is the equivalent of accuracy of thinking.
quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

quotes.quote: One man's observation is another man's closed book or flight of fancy.
quotes.author: Willard Van Orman Quine

quotes.quote: Observation and study are necessary to achieve mastery of light and form
quotes.author: Andrew Loomis

quotes.quote: Direct observation of the luminous essence of nature is for me indispensable
quotes.author: Robert Delaunay

quotes.quote: Obsession is the rocket fuel of our creativity.
quotes.author: Jordan Ritter

quotes.quote: An obsession is a way for damaged people to damage themselves more.
quotes.author: Mark Barrowcliffe

quotes.quote: Our current obsession with creativity is the result of our continued striving for immortality in an era when most people no longer believe in an after-life.
quotes.author: Arianna Huffington

quotes.quote: My obsession is to make women beautiful. When you create with that in mind, things can't go out of fashion.
quotes.author: Azzedine Alaia

quotes.quote: Obsession is what lazy people call dedication.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Obsession is a commitment; you have to believe in it, because it soon takes you over.
quotes.author: Lennard J. Davis

quotes.quote: Obsession is so extreme and so hard to imagine with the rational mind that it has a science-fiction-like quality to it-it's almost as if the obsessed one has been taken over by a replica, a pod, a facsimile of the rational person.
quotes.author: Susan Cheever

quotes.quote: There's a lot of obsession about people's personal ambitions.
quotes.author: Mary Ann Shaffer

quotes.quote: An obsession with control generally seems to reflect a fear of uncertainty.
quotes.author: Henry Mintzberg

quotes.quote: An obsession is where something will not leave your mind.
quotes.author: Eric Clapton

quotes.quote: Obsession is an attractive thing. People who are really, really interested and good at one thing and smart are attractive, if they're men.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.quote: Determination becomes obsession and then it becomes all that matters.
quotes.author: Jeremy Irvine

quotes.quote: To obsess too virulently is to walk alone in anxiety. But to obsess too little is to wall oneself off from one's own creativity.
quotes.author: Eric Maisel

quotes.quote: The obsession with instant gratification blinds us from our long-term potential.
quotes.author: Mike Dooley

quotes.quote: Obsession is the wellspring of genius and madness.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: Obsession is just another round on the merry-go-round of unfinished business.
quotes.author: Dale Andrews

quotes.quote: An obsession is an idea which you must get out of your mind if you are not to go out of your mind.
quotes.author: Evan Esar

quotes.quote: An obsession is intrusive because it does not require a permit to walk into the brain.
quotes.author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset

quotes.quote: Positive obsession is about not being able to stop just because you're afraid and full of doubts. Positive obsession is dangerous. It's about not being able to stop at all.
quotes.author: Octavia Butler

quotes.quote: A man with an obsession is a man who has very little sales resistance.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Obsessional does not necessarily mean sexual obsession, not even obsession for this, or for that in particular; to be an obsessional means to find oneself caught in a mechanism, in a trap increasingly demanding and endless.
quotes.author: Jacques Lacan

quotes.quote: Obsessions are essentially secondary to the depression, and usually clear up when the depression lifts.
quotes.author: Padmal de Silva

quotes.quote: Obsession is the single most wasteful human activity, because with an obsession you keep coming back and back and back to the same question and never get an answer.
quotes.author: Norman Mailer

quotes.quote: Once you'll find the way you'll be bound. It'll obsess you. But believe me, it'll be a magnificent obsession.
quotes.author: Paul Cavanagh

quotes.quote: Well, if you think about it, I think you'll see that the object of your obsession is invariably something negative which you have no control over.
quotes.author: Ron Vawter

quotes.quote: You ask is this an obsession? Yes, I'm sure this is an obsession. But is that bad? You have to be obsessive, I think, or it just doesn't work.
quotes.author: David Karpelis

quotes.quote: If life could have a theme song—and I believe every worthwhile one has—mine is a religion, an obsession, a mania, or all of these expressed in one word—individualism. I was born with that obsession, and I've never seen and do not know now a cause more worthy, more misunderstood, more seemingly hopeless, and tragically needed.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: The sin of pride may be a small or a great thing in someone's life and hurt vanity a passing pinprick, or a self-destroying or ever-murderous obsession.
quotes.author: Iris Murdoch

quotes.quote: For the poet, poetry is a pure obsession, a sequence of questions which have no answers, of demands that have no satisfaction other than the satisfaction of obsession itself.
quotes.author: T.R. Hummer

quotes.quote: Keeping up is the mark of a fluctuating mind that pursues nothing personal, that is unsuited to obsession, that continual impasse.
quotes.author: E.M. Cioran

quotes.quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: Obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.quote: Stand up to your obstacles and do something about them. You will find that they haven't half the strength you think they have.
quotes.author: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.quote: Obstacles are necessary for success because in selling, as in all careers of importance, victory comes only after many struggles and countless defeats.
quotes.author: Og Mandino

quotes.quote: Obstacles are like wild animals. They are cowards but they will bluff you if they can. If they see you are afraid of them... they are liable to spring upon you; but if you look them squarely in the eye, they will slink out of sight.
quotes.author: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.quote: Obstacles, of course, are developmentally necessary: they teach kids strategy, patience, critical thinking, resilience and resourcefulness.
quotes.author: Naomi Wolf

quotes.quote: Real obstacles don't take you in circles. They can be overcome. Invented ones are like a maze.
quotes.author: Barbara Sher

quotes.quote: Well, you've got certain obstacles that get in your way throughout your career, but you have to be a strong individual.
quotes.author: Floyd Mayweather, Jr.

quotes.quote: To throw obstacles in the way of a complete education is like putting out the eyes.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quotes.quote: Press on. Obstacles are seldom the same size tomorrow as they are today.
quotes.author: Robert H. Schuller

quotes.quote: No matter how many obstacles that are thrown in our path, there are ways to except them and to live through them.
quotes.author: Robert Zemeckis

quotes.quote: Most of our obstacles would melt away if, instead of cowering before them, we should make up our minds to walk boldly through them.
quotes.author: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.quote: There are plenty of difficult obstacles in your path. Don't allow yourself to become one of them.
quotes.author: Ralph Marston

quotes.quote: We have to embrace obstacles to reach the next stage of joy.
quotes.author: Goldie Hawn

quotes.quote: But the cure for most obstacles is, Be decisive.
quotes.author: George Weinberg

quotes.quote: Everyone has obstacles, and you're not going to have the right answer or do the right thing every single time.
quotes.author: Shannon Miller

quotes.quote: The more you can remove the obstacles between you and the world as a woman, the easier and simpler life becomes.
quotes.author: Cate Blanchett

quotes.quote: It takes obstacles to learn, grow, be better.
quotes.author: Orlando Bloom

quotes.quote: There are many challenges, there are many obstacles; let us try to change the obstacles to advantages.
quotes.author: Harri Holkeri

quotes.quote: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.
quotes.author: Moliere

quotes.quote: See every difficulty as a challenge, a stepping stone, and never be defeated by anything or anyone.
quotes.author: Eileen Caddy

quotes.quote: For every mountain there is a miracle.
quotes.author: Robert H. Schuller

quotes.quote: Obstacles will look large or small to you according to whether you are large or small.
quotes.author: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.quote: The mere fact that you have obstacles to overcome is in your favor...
quotes.author: Robert Collier

quotes.quote: The obstacles you face are... mental barriers which can be broken by adopting a more positive approach.
quotes.author: Clarence Blasier

quotes.quote: To solve any problem, here are three questions to ask yourself: First, what could I do? Second, what could I read? And third, who could I ask?
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.quote: There seemed to be endless obstacles... it seemed that the root cause of them all was fear.
quotes.author: Joanna Field

quotes.quote: Often one of the stumbling blocks to living a simpler life is our inability or unwillingness to change how we play some of the games that got us into these complicated lives in the first place.
quotes.author: Elaine St. James

quotes.quote: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.
quotes.author: Les Brown

quotes.quote: Every high civilization decays by forgetting obvious things.
quotes.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: The true test of a brilliant theory [is] what first is thought to be wrong is later shown to be obvious.
quotes.author: Assar Lindbeck

quotes.quote: No question is so difficult to answer as that which the answer is obvious.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: It's obvious what's timeless and what is not timeless, but you need time to find that answer.
quotes.author: Patricia Field

quotes.quote: The obvious can sometimes be illuminating when perceived in an unhabitual way.
quotes.author: Daniel Quinn

quotes.quote: It is bad to want something that not even God could attain, especially when the impossibility becomes obvious.
quotes.author: Ernest Sosa

quotes.quote: Jealousy is the most obvious sign of impotency.
quotes.author: Helen Nielsen

quotes.quote: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Readers are made by readers - it is so obvious it is almost banal to say it.
quotes.author: Aidan Chambers

quotes.quote: It pays to be obvious, especially if you have a reputation for subtlety.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
quotes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quotes.quote: It's obvious that humanity continues to be torn by religious violence.
quotes.author: Thomas Keating

quotes.quote: A man of such obvious and exemplary charm must be a liar.
quotes.author: Anita Brookner

quotes.quote: Experts always tend to obscure the obvious.
quotes.author: D. V. Ager

quotes.quote: All bad poetry springs from genuine feeling. To be natural is to be obvious, and to be obvious is to be inartistic.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The obvious is better than obvious avoidance of it.
quotes.author: Henry Watson Fowler

quotes.quote: It may not seem obvious at first glance, but the way we make decisions in life tells a lot about the kind of faith we have in Jesus Christ.
quotes.author: Jim Cymbala

quotes.quote: When somebody says that all statements are false, the obvious problem is that as an assertion it's self-defeating.
quotes.author: Henry Flynt

quotes.quote: Forgive me for stating the obvious, but the world is made up of all kinds of people.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.quote: It is obvious that the best qualities in man must atrophy in a standing-room-only environment.
quotes.author: Stewart Udall

quotes.quote: There is perhaps no more obvious vanity than to write of it so vainly.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: Everything, in retrospect, is obvious. But if everything were obvious, authors of histories of financial folly would be rich.
quotes.author: Michael Lewis

quotes.quote: Some of the best opportunities in the world are the most obvious ones.
quotes.author: Thomas G. Stemberg

quotes.quote: All that is obvious detracts completely from all that is not.
quotes.author: Emma Restall Orr

quotes.quote: Obvious to you is amazing to others.
quotes.author: Derek Sivers

quotes.quote: People tell me this is obvious. But it's ok to be obvious. Knowing and doing are different. Many people know many obvious things they completely fail to do, despite their knowledge.
quotes.author: Scott Berkun

quotes.quote: The hardest lessons to learn are those that are the most obvious.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: If something doesn't work, it becomes obvious immediately. This just isn't going to work.
quotes.author: Jerry Garcia

quotes.quote: Let us beware of common folk, common sense, sentiment, inspiration, and the obvious.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.quote: History is not life, but since only life makes history, the union of the two is obvious.
quotes.author: Louis D. Brandeis

quotes.quote: Science is always discovering odd scraps of magical wisdom and making a tremendous fuss about its cleverness.
quotes.author: Aleister Crowley

quotes.quote: I've often thought that there isn't any 'I' at all; that we are simply the means of expression of something else; that when we think we are ourselves, we are simply the victims of a delusion.
quotes.author: Aleister Crowley

quotes.quote: Black Magick is the process of self-transformation through an antinomian initiatory structure, Black meaning the hidden wisdom, power of darkness, dreams and staging the reality you wish and Magic being the process to ascend, become immortal in spirit
quotes.author: Michael W. Ford

quotes.quote: Remember that the Tarot is a great and sacred arcanum - its abuse is an obscenity in the inner and a folly in the outer. It is intended for quite other purposes than to determine when the tall dark man will meet the fair rich widow.
quotes.author: Jack Parsons

quotes.quote: The mystery religions were instituted in order to protect the marvels of the commonplace from those who would devalue them.
quotes.author: Peter Redgrove

quotes.quote: A Witch is a person who has honestly explored their light and has evolved to celebrate their darkness
quotes.author: Dacha Avelin

quotes.quote: Witches do not need to fix problems. Witches fix the energy around problems. Then the problems fix themselves.
quotes.author: Dacha Avelin

quotes.quote: Magic is an art; using reality and the world as its canvas.
quotes.author: Dacha Avelin

quotes.quote: You are the most powerful tool in your life. Use your energy, your thoughts and your magic wisely!
quotes.author: Dacha Avelin

quotes.quote: But sometimes change can be good! For instance, most occult scholars don't know this, but if you're bitten by a demon, and you live, you just might absorb some of the demon's abilities...
quotes.author: Diablo Cody

quotes.quote: Occult. The word in its original translation means 'hidden.' Therefore, the study of the occult.. Uh, therefore the study of the occult is the study of hidden knowledge. Today we're going to discuss it as it relates to.. resurrection.
quotes.author: Julie Plec

quotes.quote: This is black magic. This is hardcore. Don't mess with the occult.
quotes.author: Julian Barratt

quotes.quote: Parapsychology is the study of occult phenomena: happenings for which there's no rational explanation.
quotes.author: Glen A. Larson

quotes.quote: Yes, but the occult will always be with us, Chief Inspector. It reflects a part of our nature.
quotes.author: Daniel Boyle

quotes.quote: A little knowledge of the occult is dangerous. Unless it's used for good, disaster will follow its wake. That is Cosmic Law!
quotes.author: Clarence Upson Young

quotes.quote: There is no more foul or relentless enemy of man in the occult world, than this dead-alive creature spewed up from the grave.
quotes.author: Guy Endore

quotes.quote: In the very old days in Japan, there prevailed a belief that a betrayed woman could become possessed with an occult power, strong enough to curse her deceiver to death...
quotes.author: Toru Mihara

quotes.quote: There is a gap between what we know and what we feel. Many feel the occult can bridge that gap. It can take us beyond ourselves, to the infinite.
quotes.author: Nevill Drury

quotes.quote: They are malefic, negative and destructive. Their knowledge of the art of the occult gives them tremendous powers. They can change the course of events and people's lives, through harm.
quotes.author: Dario Argento

quotes.quote: There's no point wondering. I'm gonna find her. When I was a teenager, I started reading every book I could find on the occult. I taught myself spells, rituals, curses. I learned to conjure all kinds of dead things. Just not her. Not yet.
quotes.author: Daniel Cerone

quotes.quote: The occult, demonology, exorcisms. Just before my sister was committed, she became deeply paranoid. She started talking about demons, angels.
quotes.author: Jamie Delano

quotes.quote: In the early '30s, Adolf Hitler and his inner circle became obsessed with the occult, believing that the black arts were key to their plan for world domination.
quotes.author: David Kajganich

quotes.quote: I'm tired of travelling or fighting superstition and its many manifestations. Even though it was me who chose to debunk folklore and mysticism. Little did I know I'd end up being labelled as Patrick Galloway, the man with endless occult knowledge.
quotes.author: Clive Barker

quotes.quote: There is an occult explosion taking place in the western world / Girl on a mind trip, lost on the Midway / Sacrificed to the beat of bright boots / Taboos cut her star lust ways
quotes.author: Buzz Mc Coy

quotes.quote: Our youth and our beliefs in the occult / Your eyes glowed one last time in the dark / We’ll never really know who was at fault.
quotes.author: Groulx Martine

quotes.quote: A rare and most mysterious spring / (This most occult thing) / Is buried deep in the soul / (It's story never has been told)
quotes.author: Clifford Brown

quotes.quote: Oh when we see too recon the art occult that nothing can keep us down. / It's a dizzying feeling that's keeping us flying / Some glittering gauntlet, without even trying.
quotes.author: Martin Gore

quotes.quote: In the center of the earth a fire in the sky / The almighty nation is going down to die / Enter the gate to the ancient world / Lead by the occult science of the past and the mysterious Volk
quotes.author: Alexander Krull

quotes.quote: Come one, come all, and witness magic! / I introduce to you an occult sorcerer / Of the ancient craft of Necromancy / A caster of mind-bending illusion
quotes.author: Joseph Bruce

quotes.quote: Witness the keeper of arcane, wicked voodoo magic / A beguiler of spells, hexes, and curses / With the / help of potions, talismans, and ancient relics / From the forbidden realms of the Dark Carnival
quotes.author: Joseph Bruce

quotes.quote: The overarching goal of occupation therapy is simple: Help patients live life to the fullest.
quotes.author: Holly Goodman

quotes.quote: Some seek the comfort of their therapist's office, other head to the corner pub and dive into a pint, but I chose running as my therapy.
quotes.author: Dean Karnazes

quotes.quote: I've realized therapy is incredibly therapeutic.
quotes.author: Lisa Schroeder

quotes.quote: The role of the therapist is to reflect the being/accepting self that was never allowed to be in the borderline.
quotes.author: Michael Adzema

quotes.quote: Therapy happens to be very beneficial. I've been going for 20 years.
quotes.author: Howard Meyers

quotes.quote: Well, I don't consider therapy overreacting, I just think it's good parenting.
quotes.author: Rob Lotterstein

quotes.quote: Psychoanalysis is that mental illness for which it regards itself as therapy.
quotes.author: Jamie Moyer

quotes.quote: The best therapy is actually the more aggressive kind when they break you open; they unleash you.
quotes.author: Cara Delevingne

quotes.quote: Therapy is like telling your nightmares when you're a kid; they lose their power to hurt and control.
quotes.author: Beth Orton

quotes.quote: Therapy is extremely expensive. Popping bubble wrap is radically cheap.
quotes.author: Jimmy Buffett

quotes.quote: Therapy is not to 'talk about' things, but to change the person's life, and to relieve suffering, such as depression, anxiety, or relationship problems.
quotes.author: David D. Burns

quotes.quote: Occupational therapy practitioners know that hope still glimmers in the darkest hour.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Rest and self-care are so important. When you take time to replenish your spirit, it allows you to serve others from the overflow. You cannot serve from an empty vessel.
quotes.author: Eleanor Brownn

quotes.quote: Massage therapy has been shown to relieve depression, especially in people who have chronic fatigue syndrome; other studies also suggest benefit for other populations.
quotes.author: Andrew Weil

quotes.quote: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.quote: Therapists need to have a long experience in personal therapy to see what it's like to be on the other side of the couch and see what they find helpful or not helpful.
quotes.author: Irvin D. Yalom

quotes.quote: Man, through the use of his hands, as they are energized by mind and will, can influence the state of his own health.
quotes.author: Mary Reily

quotes.quote: Therapy can help you grow. Fears will just disappear.
quotes.author: Stephanie Mills

quotes.quote: Therapy needs to be integrated. You mustn't forget about a patient's emotional wellbeing. It is vital to the outcome of their treatment.
quotes.author: Allan Hamilton

quotes.quote: Therapy is the boat across the river, but most don't want to get off. Don't blame, forgive, All healing is self-healing.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.quote: When drug therapies do not work, we have to look for alternative approaches.
quotes.author: Darren Star

quotes.quote: I thought therapy was called 'the talking cure'.
quotes.author: Fred Barron

quotes.quote: Therapy doesn't work when you have to lie about everything.
quotes.author: Jonathan Nolan

quotes.quote: If I'm going to absorb all that negativity then I should be allowed to experience the good stuff as well. So I went to therapy and learnt how to do it.
quotes.author: Hans-Günther Brüske

quotes.quote: You're a gem. There's gotta be something to this therapy stuff.
quotes.author: Jerry Siegel

quotes.quote: So, Dale. I don't know how much you know about therapy, but it usually starts by you telling me a little something about yourself.
quotes.author: Will Ferrell

quotes.quote: Have you ever thought about getting therapy and maybe realising how brainwashed you are by multiculturalism?
quotes.author: Louis Theroux

quotes.quote: I hate to break this to you, Sarah, but what you're doing here now is not undergoing therapy.
quotes.author: Michael Brandt

quotes.quote: Nobody talks about the Therapy outside the Therapy.
quotes.author: Garrard Conley

quotes.quote: Nature is my therapy.
quotes.author: Fracisco Matias

quotes.quote: October is the fallen leaf, but it is also a wider horizon more clearly seen. It is the distant hills once more in sight, and the enduring constellations above them once again.
quotes.author: Hal Borland

quotes.quote: In the entire circle of the year there are no days so delightful as those of a fine October.
quotes.author: Alexander Smith

quotes.quote: October had the tremendous possibility. The summer's oppressive heat was a distant memory, and the golden leaves promised the world full of beautiful adventures. They made me believe in miracles.
quotes.author: Sarah Guillory

quotes.quote: October was always the least dependable of months ... full of ghosts and shadows.
quotes.author: Joy Fielding

quotes.quote: The trees are in their autumn beauty, The woodland paths are dry, Under the October twilight the water Mirrors a still sky.
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.quote:
Sweet October, fill with praise,
Rich and glowing as thy days,
Every poet's heartfelt lays.
quotes.author: Caroline May

quotes.quote:
O suns and skies and clouds of June,
And flowers of June together,
Ye cannot rival for one hour
October's bright blue weather.
quotes.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quotes.quote: In October, a maple tree before your window lights up your room like a great lamp. Even on cloudy days, its presence helps to dispel the gloom.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.quote: The sweet calm sunshine of October, now / Warms the low spot; upon its grassy mould / The purple oak-leaf falls; the birchen bough / Drops its bright spoil like arrow-heads of gold.
quotes.author: William Cullen Bryant
Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quotes.quote: Bittersweet October. The mellow, messy, leaf-kicking, perfect pause between the opposing miseries of summer and winter.
quotes.author: Carol Bishop Hipps

quotes.quote: There is no season when such pleasant and sunny spots may be lighted on, and produce so pleasant an effect on the feelings, as now in October.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.quote: The end of the summer is not the end of the world. Here's to October...
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.quote: The clear light that belongs to October was making the landscape radiant.
quotes.author: Florence Bone

quotes.quote: October is crisp days and cool nights, a time to curl up around the dancing flames and sink into a good book.
quotes.author: John Sinor

quotes.quote: October is a symphony of permanence and change.
quotes.author: Bonaro W. Overstreet

quotes.quote: October's poplars are flaming torches lighting the way to winter.
quotes.author: Nova Bair

quotes.quote: October is the opal month of the year. It is the month of glory, of ripeness. It is the picture-month.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: October, tuck tiny candy bars in my pockets and carve my smile into a thousand pumpkins.... Merry October!
quotes.author: Rainbow Rowell

quotes.quote:
O hushed October morning mild,
Begin the hours of this day slow.
Make the day seem to us less brief.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: I have been younger in October than in all the months of spring.
quotes.author: W. S. Merwin

quotes.quote: October is a fine and dangerous season in America . . . a wonderful time to begin anything at all.
quotes.author: Thomas Merton

quotes.quote: October's foliage yellows with his cold.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.quote: October is a hallelujah! reverberating in my body year-round....
quotes.author: John Nichols

quotes.quote: I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers.
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery

quotes.quote: And close at hand, the basket stood With nuts from brown October's wood.
quotes.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quotes.quote: You ought to know that October is the first Spring month.
quotes.author: Karel Capek

quotes.quote: And when October goes / The snow begins to fly / Above the smoky roofs / I watch the planes go by
quotes.author: Johnny Mercer

quotes.quote: October is the treasurer of the year / And all the months pay bounty to her store
quotes.author: Paul Laurence Dunbar

quotes.quote: And when it all burns in the wake of October / It's the month when everything can be over, and all turns to dust / When the night comes, think October
quotes.author: Stephen Lee Bruner

quotes.quote: If guilt was an animal then it would be an octopus. All slimy and wriggly with hundreds of arms that wrap around your insides and squeeze them tight.
quotes.author: Annabel Pitcher

quotes.quote: When the narrator feels like an octopus, when he says his limbs are starting to multiply, he means he has inklings of orders of perception beyond his individual body.
quotes.author: Ben Lerner

quotes.quote: He had electric blue hair that had stuck around his head like tendrils of a startled octopus.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.quote: Every science is a mutilated octopus. If its tentacles were not clipped to stumps, it would feel its way into disturbing contacts.
quotes.author: Charles Fort

quotes.quote: I have sworn before a picture of the old and mourned comrade Stalin that I won’t rest until I see these capitalist octopuses annihilated.
quotes.author: Che Guevara

quotes.quote: Dressing a baby is like putting an octopus into a string bag, making sure none of the arms hang out.
quotes.author: Chris Evans

quotes.quote: Businesses are great structures for managing big projects. It's like trying to develop the ability to walk without developing a skeleton. Once in a blue moon, you get an octopus, but for the most part, you get skeletons. Skeletons are good shit.
quotes.author: Cory Doctorow

quotes.quote: Brandt and a couch-or worse, an empty master bedroom-were a very bad combo. He morphed from vaguely risque fling to bad-boy octopus man whenever he was in the vicinity of any marginally promising flat surface.
quotes.author: Diana Peterfreund

quotes.quote: I waved back and went in, and began to sort my way through ancient building plans that had been rolled up so long that straightening them out was like six bouts with an octopus.
quotes.author: Dick Francis

quotes.quote: The family - that dear octopus from whose tentacles we never quite escape, nor, in our inmost hearts, ever quite wish to.
quotes.author: Dodie Smith

quotes.quote: Oh, I love hugging. I wish I was an octopus, so I could hug 10 people at a time!
quotes.author: Drew Barrymore

quotes.quote: Aithinne smiles. "You know," she says thoughtfully, "your hair rather looks like an octopus." Then, as if to reassure me: "I love octopi." And Aithinne is obviously a bit barmy, but nobody's perfect.
quotes.author: Elizabeth May

quotes.quote: No one ever explained the octopuses.
quotes.author: Gail Carriger

quotes.quote: Talent without discipline is like an octopus on roller skates. There's plenty of movement, but you never know if it's going to be forward, backwards, or sideways.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown

quotes.quote: Talking to that fool is like trying to put socks on an octopus!
quotes.author: James Agee

quotes.quote: I got to try the bagpipes. It was like trying to blow an octopus.
quotes.author: James Galway

quotes.quote: Now, I don't know if you can appreciate this without actually knowing her, but getting Mrs. Stricker to laugh is like getting an octopus to stand up on two legs.
quotes.author: James Patterson

quotes.quote: For the real menace of our Republic is this invisible Government which like a giant Octopus, sprawls its slimy length over our City, State, and nation.
quotes.author: John Francis Hylan

quotes.quote: When Mary is confused or perplexed, she spurts anger the way an octopus spurts ink, and hides in the dark cloud of it.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck

quotes.quote: But to ask pity of our body is like discoursing in front of an octopus, for which our words can have no more meaning than the sound of the tides, and with which we should be appalled to find ourselves condemned to live.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: At twenty life was like wrestling an octopus. Every moment mattered. At thirty it was a walk in the country. Most of the time your mind was somewhere else. By the time you got to seventy, it was probably like watching snooker on the telly.
quotes.author: Mark Haddon

quotes.quote: Exaggeration is the octopus of the English language.
quotes.author: Matthew Pearl

quotes.quote: And I wonder if, in the dark night of the sea, there, deep within its own sphere of instinct, the octopus dreams of me.
quotes.author: N. Scott Momaday

quotes.quote: I smile to myself. I have a secret: I wish I was Dumbo the Octopus.
quotes.author: Ned Vizzini

quotes.quote: Have you ever heard a blindfolded octopus unwrap a cellophane-covered bathtub?
quotes.author: Norton Juster

quotes.quote: Fashion is such an octopus. You're connected to so many people: suppliers, pattern makers, production teams, marketing teams, vendors.
quotes.author: Raf Simons

quotes.quote: Her opponent was half pill bug, half octopus, and all butt ugly. I closed my eyes again.
quotes.author: Richard Roberts

quotes.quote: Just as an octopus may have his den in some ocean cave, and come floating out a silent image of horror to attack a swimmer, so I picture such a spirit lurking in the dark of the house which he curses by his presence, and ready to float out upon all whom he can injure.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quotes.quote: The fact that three-fifths of an octopus' neurons are not in their brain, but in their arms, suggests that each arm has a mind of its own.
quotes.author: Sy Montgomery

quotes.quote: In their brief time together slothrop forms the impression that this octopus is not in good mental health, though where's his basis for comparing?
quotes.author: Thomas Pynchon

quotes.quote: Goodness and hard work are rewarded with respect.
quotes.author: Luther Campbell

quotes.quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
quotes.author: Charles Lamb

quotes.quote: Attempt the impossible in order to improve your work
quotes.author: Bette Davis

quotes.quote: If work was so good, the rich would have kept more of it for themselves.
quotes.author: David Brent

quotes.quote: Put your heart, mind, intellect and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
quotes.author: Swami Sivananda

quotes.quote: Do the things you like to be happier, stronger & more successful. Only so is hard work replaced by dedication.
quotes.author: Rossana Condoleo

quotes.quote: I like work; it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.
quotes.author: Jerome K. Jerome

quotes.quote: No great achiever even those who made it seem easy ever succeeded without hard work.
quotes.author: Jonathan Sacks

quotes.quote: A glass of beer shortens your life by one minute, a glass of wine by two minutes, and a day of work by seven to ten hours.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Choose your company the way you choose your life partner; after all, you spend more time in the company than with your life partner
quotes.author: Ravi Kapilavai

quotes.quote: I used to work at the unemployment office. I hated it, because when they fired me, I had to show up to work anyway.
quotes.author: Wally Wang

quotes.quote: One of the things people did best at the office was to use flexibility to its last atom.
quotes.author: Pawan Mishra

quotes.quote: Inspiration is the windfall from hard work and focus. Muses are too unreliable to keep on the payroll.
quotes.author: Helen Hanson

quotes.quote: The office is like an army, and I'm the field general. You're my foot soldiers and customer quality is the war!!!
quotes.author: David Brent

quotes.quote: The best way to appreciate your job is to imagine yourself without one.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: No one's dream job involves a kiosk.
quotes.author: Damien Fahey

quotes.quote: I have so much paperwork I'm afraid my paperwork has paperwork.
quotes.author: Gabrielle Zevin

quotes.quote: This struggle and scramble for office, for a way to live without work, will finally test the strength of our institutions.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: The elevator to success is out of order. You'll have to use the stairsâ€¦ one step at a time.
quotes.author: Joe Girard

quotes.quote: When People in sales are at work, they are at war.
quotes.author: honeya

quotes.quote: Office Signs are glamorous yet subtle indicators, which reminds us who are who and what is what.
quotes.author: Nikita Dudani

quotes.quote: Talent means nothing, while experience, acquired in humility and with hard work, means everything.
quotes.author: Patrick Suskind

quotes.quote: No man goes before his time - unless the boss leaves early.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: Office hours are from 12 to 1 with an hour off for lunch.
quotes.author: George S. Kaufman

quotes.quote: People who work sitting down get paid more than people who work standing up.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote: During rough time in a Business, a Leader should act like a ship captain. His first and foremost priority should be to put his employees to security before thinking of his own welfare.
quotes.author: Indy Bissessur

quotes.quote: Work is the greatest thing in the world. So we should always save some of it for tomorrow.
quotes.author: Don Herold

quotes.quote: Coming together is a beginning Keeping together is progress Working together is success
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: I truly believe the wireless mouse was invented so people at work had one less thing to hang themselves with.
quotes.author: Mike Vanatta

quotes.quote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: We need a balanced, long term energy policy to reduce our dependence on foreign oil and preserve the beauty of the land we love.
quotes.author: Heather Wilson

quotes.quote: Truth will rise above falsehood as oil above water.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: It is wise to apply the oil of refined politeness to the mechanisms of friendship.
quotes.author: Colette

quotes.quote: The more we focus on using renewable fuels, the less we are dependent upon foreign oil.
quotes.author: John M. McHugh

quotes.quote: God's grace is the oil that fills the lamp of love.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: A little oil makes machinery work easy.
quotes.author: Fanny Fern

quotes.quote: To keep the lamp burning you have to keep putting the oil in it.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: Whoever controls oil controls much more than oil.
quotes.author: John McCain

quotes.quote: Oil is a lousy investment becauseÂ it isn't an investment. It's just aÂ bet--and it's a bet with a ticking time bomb attached to it.
quotes.author: Dan Dicker

quotes.quote: There is no free market for oil.
quotes.author: T. Boone Pickens

quotes.quote: Oil creates the illusion of a completely changed life, life without work, life for free. Oil is a resource that anaesthetises thought, blurs vision, corrupts.
quotes.author: Ryszard Kapuscinski

quotes.quote: The oil market is especially sensitive even to a hint of expansion or contraction in supply.
quotes.author: James Surowiecki

quotes.quote: Oil is ancient wealth in the ground.
quotes.author: Harold Hamm

quotes.quote: We aren't addicted to oil, but our cars are.
quotes.author: R. James Woolsey, Jr.

quotes.quote: Oil is like a wild animal. Whoever captures it has it.
quotes.author: J. Paul Getty

quotes.quote: Oil prices have certainly become a threat for the world economy.
quotes.author: Rodrigo Rato

quotes.quote: Oil demand is going to continue to grow as population grows.
quotes.author: Rex Tillerson

quotes.quote: We have to get the oil where the oil is.
quotes.author: Ron Johnson

quotes.quote: Oil has allowed us to think about economics as though energy doesn't matter.
quotes.author: Andrew Nikiforuk

quotes.quote: Oil is a very important component of economic growth.
quotes.author: Maria Bartiromo

quotes.quote: It's not oil that runs the world, it's shame.
quotes.author: Sherman Alexie

quotes.quote: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you're aboard, there's nothing you can do.
quotes.author: Golda Meir

quotes.quote: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
quotes.author: Fred Astaire

quotes.quote: Old age is no place for sissies.
quotes.author: Bette Davis

quotes.quote: To me - old age is always ten years older than I am.
quotes.author: Bernard M. Baruch

quotes.quote: Old age is far more than white hair, wrinkles, the feeling that it is too late and the game finished, that the stage belongs to the rising generations. The true evil is not the weakening of the body, but the indifference of the soul.
quotes.author: Andre Maurois

quotes.quote: What makes old age hard to bear is not the failing of one's faculties, mental and physical, but the burden of one's memories.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, reverent that is to triumph over old age.
quotes.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quotes.quote: Old age is just a record of one's whole life.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: You end up as you deserve. In old age you must put up with the face, the friends, the health, and the children you have earned.
quotes.author: Judith Viorst

quotes.quote: Old age, believe me, is a good and pleasant thing. It is true you are gently shouldered off the stage, but then you are given such a comfortable front stall as spectator.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Old age is not a disease - it is strength and survivorship, triumph over all kinds of vicissitudes and disappointments, trials and illnesses.
quotes.author: Maggie Kuhn

quotes.quote: Old age may have its limitations and challenges, but in spite of them, our latter years can be some of the most rewarding and fulfilling of our lives.
quotes.author: Billy Graham

quotes.quote: A comfortable old age is the reward of a well-spent youth. Instead of its bringing sad and melancholy prospects of decay, it would give us hopes of eternal youth in a better world.
quotes.author: Maurice Chevalier

quotes.quote: Old age is the most unexpected of all things that happen to a man.
quotes.author: Leon Trotsky

quotes.quote: Old age has deformities enough of its own. It should never add to them the deformity of vice.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Old age comes on suddenly, and not gradually as is thought.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: Old age is the verdict of life.
quotes.author: Amelia E Barr

quotes.quote: A graceful and honorable old age is the childhood of immortality.
quotes.author: Pindar

quotes.quote: Old age is not a matter for sorrow. It is matter for thanks if we have left our work done behind us.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: I have the problems of, I must confess, old age.
quotes.author: Billy Graham

quotes.quote: Not even old age knows how to love death.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.quote: Old age: the crown of life, our play's last act.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.quote: It is not well to make great changes in old age.
quotes.author: Spurgeon

quotes.quote: Old age has its pleasures, which, though different, are not less than the pleasures of youth.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Old age is an excellent time for outrage. My goal is to say or do at least one outrageous thing every week.
quotes.author: Louis Kronenberger

quotes.quote: Old age is the most unexpected of all the things that can happen to a man.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.quote: Old age: I fall asleep during the funerals of my friends.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: Old age is always wakeful; as if, the longer linked with life, the less man has to do with aught that looks like death.
quotes.author: Herman Melville

quotes.quote: Old age isn't so bad when you consider the alternative.
quotes.author: Maurice Chevalier

quotes.quote: The harvest of old age is the recollection and abundance of blessing previously secured.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.quote: A man's growth is seen in the successsive choirs of his friends.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Of oil, wine, and friends, the oldest is the best.
quotes.author: Portuguese Proverb

quotes.quote: In dress, the newest is the finest; in friends, the oldest is the best.
quotes.author: Korean Proverb

quotes.quote: In forming new friendships, forget not old friends.
quotes.author: Roman Proverb

quotes.quote: One should not forsake old friends for new, because the old friends, having already proven their calibre, are more trustworthy.
quotes.author: G. Llewellyn Watson

quotes.quote: We need new friends; some of us are cannibals who have eaten their old friends up; others must have ever-renewed audiences before whom to re-enact an ideal version of their lives.
quotes.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.quote: I keep my old friends, and get older with them, but push young. It's good to be surrounded by kids, because they keep you young.
quotes.author: Carine Roitfeld

quotes.quote: When you meet with your old friends, you recollect some of the finest moments of your life and find yourself in a joy that has no comparison.
quotes.author: Syed Badiuzzaman

quotes.quote: When we are old, our friends find it difficult to please us, and are less concerned whether we be pleased or not.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: Though you are in your shining days / Voices among the crowd / And new friends busy with your praise / Be not unkind or proud / But think about old friends the most / Time's bitter flood will rise / Your beauty perish and be lost / For all eyes but these eyes.
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.quote: New friends may be poems but old friends are alphabets. Don't forget the alphabets because you will need them to read the poems.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.
quotes.author: John Webster

quotes.quote: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown

quotes.quote: An old friend never can be found, and nature has provided that he cannot easily be lost.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr

quotes.quote: It's an insane world but in it there is one sanity, the loyalty of old friends.
quotes.author: Ben Hur

quotes.quote: It's best to have an old friend far away, than a new friend nearby that makes you question your care.
quotes.author: Shanna Rodriguez

quotes.quote: Whoever neglects old friends for the sake of new deserves what he gets if he loses both.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: When we forget old friends, it is a sign we have forgotten ourselves.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: Say what you want about aging, it's still the only way to have old friends.
quotes.author: Robert Brault

quotes.quote: Beautiful memories are like old friends. They may not always be on your mind, but they are forever in your heart.
quotes.author: Susan Gale
